intro: Crithodium jerevanii, commonly known as the Armenian crithmoid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the dry, temperate climate of its native habitat. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
